sen.j: 七将（ななしょう）とは豊臣秀吉子飼い大名で猛将として知られた7人の武将をあらわす。
sen.e: The Seven Generals (shown below) were Seven feudal lords famous as the brave generals who were trained by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
The Seven Generals (or "Nanasho") are the feudal lords who were reared by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI from an early age and famous as the brave generals.

sen.j: 五大老の一人で武断派（福島正則、加藤清正ら武力でのし上がった者）と文治派（石田三成、浅野長政ら政治向きなことでのし上がった者）の対立を仲裁していた前田利家が死去。
sen.e: Toshiie MAEDA, one of the five regents of Hideyoshi, died--He was a mediator between the Militarist Faction including Masanori FUKUSHIMA and Kiyomasa KATO who rose to power using their military forces and the Civilian Faction including Mitsunari ISHIDA and Nagamasa ASANO who rose to power through their statesmanship.

sen.j: 2派の関係を仲裁するものがいなくなったのでさらに2派の確執が増した。
sen.e: Without any mediator, the feud between the two factions turned violent.

sen.j: 以前から三成に深い恨みを抱いていた七将は手勢を率いて大坂城下の加藤清正の屋敷に集合し、そこから三成を襲い三成を討ち取る計画を立てていた。
sen.e: The Seven Generals, with long-harbored resentment, schemed to defeat Mitsunari--They planned to head their armies to the residence of Kiyomasa KATO near Osaka Castle to attack Mitsunari together.
The Seven Generals, with long-harbored resentment, schemed to defeat Mitsunari by heading their armies to Kiyomasa KATO's residence near the Osaka-jo Castle and attack Mitsunari together.
sen.cmt: schemed 以下を全文修正しました。
sen.e: The Seven Generals, with long-harbored resentment, schemed to defeat Mitsunari by heading their armies to Kiyomasa KATO's residence near the Osaka-jo Castle and attack Mitsunari together.

sen.j: しかし三成はそれを察知し盟友・佐竹義宣 (右京大夫)の屋敷に重臣・島清興（左近）らとともに逃れた。
sen.e: Mitsunari perceived their scheme and fled with his chief vassal Kiyooki SHIMA (also known as Sakon SHIMA) to the residence of his ally Yoshinobu SATAKE (Ukyo no daibu).

sen.j: 七将は三成がいないことが分かり、大坂城下の諸大名の屋敷をしらみつぶしに探し、佐竹邸にも加藤軍が迫った。
sen.e: Having noticed that Mitsunari had fled, the Seven Generals started to raid each one of the feudal lords' residences near Osaka Castle, and the army of KATO headed for the residence of SATAKE..
Having noticed that Mitsunari had fled, the Seven Generals started to raid each one of the feudal lords' residences near the Osaka-jo Castle, and the army of KATO headed for Satake's residence.

sen.j: すると三成は伏見にある政敵・徳川家康の屋敷に逃れることにした。
sen.e: Now, Mitsunari decided to take refuge in the residence of his political opponent Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in Fushimi.
Now, Mitsunari decided to take refuge in the residence of his political opponent Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in Fushimi.

sen.j: 三成、左近一行は女装して佐竹邸を抜け出し、伏見の徳川邸に到着、家康は本多正信から伝えられ家康は豊臣家が内で争っている間に力を蓄えておく思惑があったので三成を匿うことにした。
sen.e: Sneaked out of the Satake residence in female attire, a band of Mitsunari and Sakon arrived at the Tokugawa residence in Fushimi--Reported on their arrival by Masanobu HONDA, Ieyasu decided to give refuge to Mitsunari to increase military capability during the internal trouble of the Toyotomi.

sen.j: 翌朝、七将が家康に三成を引き渡すように要求したが家康は「三成を斬るならば先にこの家康を斬れ」と言って要求をはねつけた。
sen.e: Ieyasu flatly rejected the request by the Seven Generals in the next morning to extradite Mitsunari, saying 'Over my dead body'.

sen.j: 家康はその代わり三成を隠居させると約束させ、次男・結城秀康に三成を三成の居城・佐和山城に送り届けた。
sen.e: Ieyasu forced Mitsunari to promise to retire in exchange for being saved from extradition, and had his second son Hideyasu YUKI send Mitsunari to Sawayama Castle, Mitsunari's home castle.

sen.e: All the Seven Generals took the leading role in the Eastern army in the Battle of Sekigahara, which broke out about one and half years later.
